children.name: Summary
children.heading: Dynamo - Montreal, CAN
children.description: Worked throughout January and February helping out with their backlogs. I worked primarily on two Spree apps: Blue Bottle Coffee and Quarterly. Some of the major issues that I worked on was providing site admins the ability to manage customer credit cards, manage addresses to paid subscriptions, and provide various reports regarding product performance. I also helped with various troubleshooting issues regarding front-end functionality.

children.name: D3 Resume
children.heading: d3-resume.herokuapp.com
children.description: You're looking at it! Built with Sinatra, D3.js, and coffeescript

children.name: Harmonize
children.heading: harmonize.herokuapp.com
children.description: A CRM (Client Relations Manager) that aims to help freelancers manage projects, contacts, and leads. Built on Rails 4 and Postgres using Haml, SASS, CoffeeScript, and jQuery for front-end support.

children.name: New York State Constitution
children.heading: nys-constitution.herokuapp.com/
children.description: App for the New York State Constitution that aims to provide a better reading experience and that is easier to navigate over its state funded counterpart. App served the purpose to improve front-end skills and provided an opportunity to move away from CSS frameworks. Focused on developing a better sense of how elements should be spaced out and how typography can be used to provide a more enjoyable reading experience.

children.name: NYC Code Browser
children.heading: github.com/countxyz/nyc_code_browser
children.description: Provides a new data visualization interface to ease user navigation of 30,000 laws from the New York City Administrative Code site. Browser inspired by the Open Law DC project. Created 2 JSONifiers, using Nokogiri, that were responsible for crawling and scraping administrative code site. Project used to learn Javascript, jQuery, D3.js, node.js, and AngularJS.

children.name: MastaMindz LLC
children.heading: www.mastamindzllc.com
children.description: Built site to incorporate modern web design, functionality, and user interaction. Built with Rails 4 with a responsive UI using Zurb Foundation 4. Consultation & implementation on new web infrastructure, domain name service, and hosting. Consulted owners regarding site operations, increasing site traffic, and improving marketing performance

children.name: Summary
children.heading: Network Engineering - Research
children.description: Learning and exploring network engineering as a hobbyist. Used software such as Cisco Packet Tracer and GNS3 to explore different versions of Cisco IOS and as a platform to execute proof-of-concept work. Software was also used for network design. Learned to use wireshark for techniques such as port mirroring (tapping the wire) and to troubleshoot common enterprise network failure with a focus on DNS.

children.name: Summary
children.heading: Network Security / Hardware Hacking / Linux
children.description: Began to take my interest in computer sciences seriously and was fascinated on making computers do things they were not intended to do.

children.name: First Hack
children.heading: First Hack
children.description: Hacked Playstation 3 and implemented a dual boot with Fedora 3.

children.name: Wireless
children.heading: WEP, WPA, WPA2
children.description: Began using software such as Aircrack-ng, Kismet, John the Ripper, rainbow tables, and wireshark to penetrate WEP, WPA, and WPA2 networks.

children.name: Port Scanning
children.heading: Port Scanning
children.description: Learned port scanning with Nmap to detect vulnerabilities while limiting my digital footprint on the network.

children.name: Languages
children.heading: ASM & Perl
children.description: Used ASM to write shell scripts and deliver payloads with Perl with the aim of gaining complete system control of Windows XP and 7.

children.name: System Administration
children.heading: Linux, MAC, Windows
children.description: Learned basic System Administration skills by having to set up various OS environments and at certain patch levels.
